ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: So much fun! Professor Sodi is a delight. This class is a great way to continue your Italian education--you will both work on your language skills and learn a lot about modern Italian culture.
I would recommend this fabulous course!

A great introduction to Italian opera and film and a great opportunity to speak Italian three times a week. Very fun due to Prof.essa Sodi's use of movies and youtube videos, but there is a weekly movie screening that you have to watch on your own time. Very relaxed course--very much worth your time.

Italian 157 is a solid course that gives a good sampling of Italian films and operas. We covered about one opera or film every week and also wrote a short essay about once a week. I preferred the films to the operas, but it was nice to get some of both. Also, the final project was pretty fun; we made a video incorporating characters from the operas and films from the course, and prof.ssa Sodi loved it. Prof.ssa Sodi is a wonderful professor, by the way.

We watched an opera or a film every week outside of class and wrote either a short assignment (250 words) or a long assignment (500) about every other week. In class, we discussed the films as a group and did short presentations.
You learn a vocabulary for talking about the arts in Italian, which considering the fact that it's Italian, is pretty useful. Take it.
